intro: Carex breviaristata, commonly known as the short-bracted sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is native to North America and is typically found in wet or moist environments such as marshes and along stream banks. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers in spikelets. It is often used in wetland restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and improve water quality. Carex breviaristata is an important component of aquatic and riparian ecosystems.
